abstract: A precipitous slowdown in advertising growth has raised new questions about AOL’s transformation plans.
snippet: A precipitous slowdown in advertising growth has raised new questions about AOL’s transformation plans.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 17 — Just over a year ago, AOL unveiled a radical plan to remake itself into a business built on advertising from one driven by Internet access subscriptions.

headline.main: Ad Growth for AOL Called Vital to a Remake
headline.print_headline: Ad Growth For AOL Called Vital To a Remake

abstract: Europe’s top appeals court will announce its decision Sept. 17 on Microsoft’s appeal of Europe’s largest antitrust case ever.
snippet: Europe’s top appeals court will announce its decision Sept. 17 on Microsoft’s appeal of Europe’s largest antitrust case ever.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Perhaps the most closely watched figure in European legal circles this summer has been Bo Vesterdorf, the Danish judge who heads Europe’s top appeals court, with antitrust lawyers hanging on his every public utterance.

headline.main: European Legal Circles Await Ruling by Top Appeals Court on Microsoft
headline.print_headline: European Legal Circles Await Ruling By Top Appeals Court on Microsoft

abstract: As the dust settles on an active week in virtualization software, some observers speculated that Microsoft could attempt to top Citrix Systems’ $500 million bid for virtualization specialist XenSource.
lead_paragraph: As the dust settles on an active week in virtualization software, some observers speculated that Microsoft could attempt to top Citrix Systems’ $500 million bid for virtualization specialist XenSource.

headline.main: Will Microsoft Elbow in on XenSource Deal?

abstract: Skype explains that its service went down for two days last week after a routine Microsoft patch forced masses of users to restart their computers at the same time.
snippet: Skype explains that its service went down for two days last week after a routine Microsoft patch forced masses of users to restart their computers at the same time.
lead_paragraph: This morning Skype released a statement explaining its two-day outage last week – and pinning the root cause on a routine Microsoft update to the Windows operating system that caused masses of users to reboot their PCs at the same time. In an interview last week, Skype’s chief security officer said he did not think that Microsoft had anything to do with the service’s collapse. Skype engineers must have subsequently decided otherwise.

headline.main: Skype: Microsoft Update Took Us Down

abstract: Cisco and Microsoft join hands in peace and harmony, sort of.
snippet: Cisco and Microsoft join hands in peace and harmony, sort of.
lead_paragraph: In corporate technology circles, people talk of the “red team” — Microsoft and its allies — and the “blue team” — led by IBM and Cisco. Today John Chambers, the chief executive of Cisco, and Steven Ballmer, Microsoft’s chief executive, shared a stage in New York to announce an alliance of necessity.
